news_header: Sir David Attenborough reflects on the impact of wildlife broadcasting over his 70-year career, emphasizing its role in raising awareness about conservation issues.
news_text: Seventy years into his broadcasting career, Sir David Attenborough acknowledges the significant influence of wildlife programs on public awareness of conservation. He believes that without these broadcasts, the world's ecological situation would be much worse. As the BBC prepares to celebrate 90 years of broadcasting from Bristol in September 2024, Attenborough recalls the evolution of wildlife programming since his start in 1954, noting the shift from capturing animals for zoos to highlighting the risks faced by the natural world. He emphasizes that the fascination and beauty of nature captured in these programs have been crucial in fostering a global understanding of ecological issues. Attenborough's upcoming series, 'Asia,' is set to premiere in late 2024, continuing his legacy in natural history broadcasting.
